result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance A Stokes

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. STATES REQUESTED JURY INSTRUCTION
Received and Filed. STATES MOTION IN LIMINE
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Terrance A Stokes not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Defense, further requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 11/10/2022. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 16.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Filings Due scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Letter from Defendant requesting speedy trial (Terrance A. Stokes #403324 - Dodge Correctional Institution P.O. Box 189  1 W LINCOLN ST, WAUPUN, WI. 53963)

Defendant Terrance A Stokes in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Terrance A Stokes in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Anders. Court took judicial notice of Manitowoc County case 16CF631. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Terrance A Stokes not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant is housed at Dodge; Dodge does not have a video booth available for todays proceedings. Defense moves to dismiss; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court,appear by video. Defendant Terrance A Stokes not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Dodge unable to produce defendant by video for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Terrance A Stokes not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for State v Lee hearing. Atty McGinn was recently appointed by the SPD office and is requesting a Preliminary Hearing date. Case adjourned to Prelim Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance A Stokes not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE State V-LEE Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance A Stokes not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Terrance A Stokes not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Terrance A Stokes in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Terrance A Stokes in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrance A Stokes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance scheduled via Zoom. Defendant is in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Appearance has been cancelled due to medical issue (hospital).  Intake Coordinator will reschedule.
